    Activities

    Highlights of my professional engagement beyond researchâ€”demos, mentorship, events, and talks.

    Simulation Demos

    High-Speed SerDes Transmitter

    October 2025
    Initial Eye Diagram Simulation
    This project focuses on the architecture of a 56Gbps PAM4 transmitter. In this phase, I am verifying the equalization logic using Cadence Virtuoso. The video below demonstrates the adaptive equalizer convergence and the resulting eye opening after channel loss.

    Mixed-Signal Layout Automation

    August 2025
    Scripting in SKILL & Python
    An ongoing effort to automate the layout generation for differential pairs to minimize parasitic mismatch. This tool takes a netlist as input and automatically places devices with common-centroid matching. The demo shows the script execution and DRC check.

    Ongoing Tasks

    Low-Power ADC Design

    November 2025
    12-bit SAR ADC Optimization
    Working on optimizing power consumption for a 12-bit SAR ADC targeting IoT applications. Currently focusing on comparator design and capacitor DAC sizing.

    Clock Distribution Network

    December 2025
    Multi-GHz Clock Tree Synthesis
    Designing a low-jitter clock distribution network for a high-speed SoC. Investigating different buffer topologies and clock tree architectures.

    Event Organization

    Weekly AI Seminar Series

    2024 - Present
    Co-organizer

    Co-organizing a weekly seminar series featuring speakers from academia and industry discussing cutting-edge AI and machine learning research.

    University Data Science Hackathon

    2024
    Lead Organizer

    Organized the annual Data Science Hackathon with 150+ participants, coordinating sponsors, mentors, and logistics.

    Mentorship & Outreach

    Undergraduate Research Mentorship

    Summer 2024
    Research Mentor

    Mentored 3 undergraduate students for their summer capstone projects focusing on analog IC design and signal processing.

    Science Fair Volunteer

    2024
    Judge & Mentor

    Volunteered at the local Science Fair for high school students, providing feedback and guidance on electronics and engineering projects.
